Raw description:  Assist in the implementation of all marketing projects, working with the Marketing Director to execute the marketing plan and effectively deliver on strategic goals for the department and the organization as a whole. Oversee OBC’s social media networks, including writing, scheduling and moderating posted content, as well as analytics reporting and overall monitoring; help to promote audience growth and brand awareness through successful community engagement; recruit and supervise interns to support social efforts as necessary. Oversee updates to and maintenance of the Outward Bound Canada website, including taking an active role in working with our external web developer and designer, as well as internal team members across the country, to ensure information is accurate and up-to-date; writing and posting content, sourcing and editing photos as required. Coordination of Outward Bound Canada’s e-newsletter (Fresh Tracks) and e-blasts, including content creation, approvals, and online delivery (via email marketing software); working with branded design templates and modifying designs as necessary. Write and design digital ads (both video and photography based) and coordinate ad buys (e.g. Facebook); work with external designer and in-house templates to produce print ads as required. Coordinate the production and delivery of publications (e.g. Impact Report) and other materials. Communicate design and website requests and timelines to external graphic designer / videographer and web designer / developer. Maintain accurate records in the database for marketing purposes. Represent the brand at occasional marketing and fundraising events. Assisting with marketing-specific administrative tasks (e.g. maintaining an inventory of marketing materials, processing marketing requests from internal staff) and other tasks, as required. Post-secondary diploma / degree in marketing, communications or a related field. Hands on experience in marketing, communications or a related industry (can be a combination of academic and professional experience). Foundational knowledge of digital marketing and community engagement. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to produce creative content for a variety of purposes, ranging from very short ad copy to longer blog posts or publication content. Comfortable utilizing and engaging with a wide variety of social networks and community moderation tools, which may include Facebook, Twitter, Hootsuite, LinkedIn, Instagram and/or Flickr (prior experience with community moderation for other brands a strong asset). Strong organizational, communication and administrative skills, and proven ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities and deadlines. Technologically savvy with a high level of computer (Mac and PC) and smartphone / app competency; strong experience with Microsoft Office programs (particularly Word and PowerPoint, familiarity with Excel), Google Mail and apps, CMS and CRM, and cloud computing. A keen eye and passion for design, video and/or photography (experience in this area an asset). Experience with content management systems (e.g. WordPress) and HTML a strong asset; experience using a central database or other tracking software an asset. Preference will be shown towards candidates with previous marketing and/or communications experience, and ability to demonstrate skills and success in writing, design and/or marketing. Passion for, knowledge of and/or experience pertaining to outdoor adventure and education considered a strong asset. Position: Marketing Coordinator Immediate Supervisor: Marketing Director Location: Toronto, ON Start date: September 2018 Since 1969, Outward Bound Canada has made it our mission to cultivate resilience, leadership, connections and compassion, through inspiring and challenging journeys of self-discovery in the natural world. A not-for-profit, charitable, educational organization, we have challenged over 150,000 Canadians to step out of their comfort zone with our unique outdoor adventures. We pride ourselves on offering transformational journeys that encourage participants to push beyond their limits and discover their true potential. ABOUT THE POSITION The marketing portfolio is key in growing and developing the Outward Bound Canada business, implementing the organization’s strategic plan and delivering on our mission, vision and values. The Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for assisting in the application of marketing strategies, primarily through strategic day-to-day interaction with, and quality-driven care of, the organization’s digital platforms and social media networks. Reporting to the Marketing Director, the Marketing Coordinator will function as a champion and guardian of the brand, delivering inspiring and impactful content that will promote program offerings and fundraising initiatives, and help to enhance and elevate the Outward Bound Canada name. This role will be key in helping to execute strategies relating to the organization’s 50th anniversary in 2019. This is the ideal role for someone with strong creative instincts and abilities, who is likely at an early stage in their professional career, eager to take on a variety of tasks and gain valuable experience in several areas of marketing and communications. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE DESIRED READY TO APPLY? Please send cover letter and CV to marketing[AT]outwardbound.ca. If possible, please include link(s) to your professional portfolio or examples of content that you’ve created and/or designed (these can be included in your cover letter or sent via a separate document). Application deadline: July 31, 2018 Outward Bound Canada is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please. Job Type: Full-time Apply Now
